tuv.seg: Emergency health services in Ireland provide medical attention for illnesses or injuries requiring immediate treatment
Déanann seirbhísí éigeandála sláinte in Éirinn freastal míochaine ar thinnis nó ar ghortuithe a mbíonn cóireáil leighis de dhíth ina leith láithreach
Typical examples of injuries that may require emergency health services include those resulting from accidents, heart attacks or other sudden illnesses
D’fhéadfadh seirbhísí éigeandála sláinte a bheith riachtanach le haghaidh gnáthshamplaí gortuithe lena n-áirítear gortuithe a tharla de bharr timpistí, taomanna croí nó galair thobanna eile
Emergency health services are usually delivered by a general practitioner (GP), ambulance personnel or by attendance at the Accident and Emergency Department of an acute hospital
De ghnáth is dochtúir ginearálta (GP), pearsanra otharchairr nó foireann na roinne Timpistí agus Éigeandála in ospidéal géarmhíochaine a chuireann seirbhísí éigeandála sláinte ar fáil
The Department of Health has overall responsibility for policy on accident and emergency health services in Ireland
Is ar an Roinn Sláinte atá an fhreagracht fhoriomlán maidir le beartas le haghaidh seirbhísí sláinte timpistí agus éigeandála in Éirinn
The Health Service Executive (HSE) has responsibility for the delivery of public health emergency health services
Is í Feidhmeannacht na Seirbhíse Sláinte (FSS) atá freagrach as seirbhísí éigeandála sláinte poiblí a chur ar fáil
In the public health service, the National Ambulance Service provides ambulance services for transporting seriously ill people to hospitals or between hospitals
Sa tseirbhís sláinte poiblí, cuireann an tSeirbhís Náisiúnta Otharcharranna seirbhísí otharcharranna ar fáil chun daoine atá go dona tinn a iompar chuig ospidéil phoiblí nó idir ospidéil phoiblí
The Dublin Fire Brigade provides an emergency ambulance service for the greater Dublin area
Cuireann Briogáid Dóiteáin Bhaile Átha Cliath seirbhís otharcharranna ar fáil do mhórcheantar Bhaile Átha Cliath
Emergency ambulance services can be contacted by telephoning 999 or 112
Is féidir leat teagmháil a dhéanamh leis na seirbhísí otharcharranna mar chuid de na seirbhísí éigeandála trí ghlao a chur ar 999 nó ar 112
(The 112 number applies throughout the EU)
(Tá an uimhir 112 i bhfeidhm ar fud an AE)
All calls are free
Bíonn gach glao saor in aisce
Where services are provided to bring patients to or from non-urgent healthcare, other vehicles may be used if appropriate (for example taxis or minibuses)
Sa chás ina gcuirtear seirbhísí ar fáil d'othair chun iad a thabhairt chuig nó ó chúram sláinte neamh-phráinneach, is féidir feithiclí eile a úsáid más cuí (mar shampla tacsaithe nó mionbhusanna)
The Intermediate Care Service provides vehicles for transport of patients between hospitals and other medical facilities to ensure emergency ambulances are available to respond to emergencies

Soláthraíonn an tSeirbhís Chúraim Idirmheánach feithiclí d'iompar na n-othar idir ospidéil agus saoráidí leighis eile chun a chinntiú go bhfuil otharcharranna éigeandála ar fáil chun freagra a thabhairt ar éigeandálaí
Unless you have a medical card, you may be charged for ambulance services
Mura bhfuil cárta leighis agat, d'fhéadfaí costas na seirbhíse otharcharranna a ghearradh ort
However, the practice varies between different parts of the country and charges may be waived in certain cases, for example, in cases of hardship
Mar sin féin ní hionann an cleachtas idir páirteanna éagsúla den tír agus d’fhéadfaí costais a tharscaoileadh i gcásanna áirithe, mar shampla, i gcásanna cruatain
There are a number of private ambulance services, including air ambulance services
Tá roinnt seirbhísí otharcharranna príobháideacha, lena n-áirítear seirbhísí aerárthacha
You can call them and pay for their services in the normal commercial manner
Ghlaonn tú orthu agus íocann tú as a gcuid seirbhísí sa ghnáthmhodh tráchtála
There are also a number of volunteer ambulance organisations
Tá roinnt eagraíochtaí deonacha otharcharranna ann freisin
They are generally used to provide immediate assistance at public events
Úsáidtear iad de ghnáth chun cúnamh láithreach a chur ar fáil ag imeachtaí poiblí

The Pre-Hospital Emergency Care Council is the national body with responsibility for the professional regulation of ambulance personnel and for education and training in the area of pre-hospital emergency care in Ireland

Is í an Chomhairle um Chúram Práinne Réamh-Ospidéil an comhlacht náisiúnta atá freagrach as rialáil ghairmiúil pearsanra otharcharranna agus as oideachas agus oiliúint i réimse cúraim éigeandála réamh-ospidéal in Éirinn
Family doctor (GP) emergency care
Cúram éigeandála ó dhochtúir teaghlaigh (GP)
If you wish to attend your family doctor (GP) as a result of an emergency you can:
Má theastaíonn uait freastal ar do dhochtúir teaghlaigh (GP) de dheasca éigeandála, is iad seo a leanas na roghanna atá ann chun teagmháil a dhéanamh leo;
• Attend at a surgery operated by your GP during specific hours
• Freastal ar lialann arna hoibriú ag do GP i rith uaireanta áirithe
You can find out what these hours are by contacting your GP
Is féidir leat a fháil amach cad iad na huaireanta seo trí dhul i dteagmháil le do GP
• Phone your GP and ask for them to visit you during the time set aside for house calls
• Glao teileafóin a chur ar do GP agus iarraidh air/uirthi cuairt a thabhairt ort i rith an ama atá curtha ar leataobh le haghaidh cuairteanna tí
• Phone your GP outside normal hours – the answering machine will usually indicate the number to ring in emergencies
• Glaoch a chur ar do GP lasmuigh de ghnáthuaireanta – beidh an uimhir le haghaidh éigeandálaí le fáil i dteachtaireacht an ghléis de ghnáth
This number may be a locum service or out-of-hours service
D’fhéadfadh an uimhir seo a bheith i gcomhair seirbhíse ionadaí nó seirbhíse lasmuigh d’uaireanta gnó
A locum service is one in which another doctor (not your GP) calls to the home of patients outside normal hours
Is éard is seirbhís ionadaí ná go dtabharfaidh dochtúir eile (seachas do GP) cuairt ar theach othair lasmuigh de ghnáthuaireanta
• Visit a GP out-of-hours co-operative
• Cuairt a thabhairt ar chomharchumann le haghaidh GP lasmuigh de ghnáthuaireanta
In parts of Ireland, GPs have come together to form co-operatives providing a medical service outside normal working hours
I bpáirteanna d’Éirinn, tagann GPanna le chéile d’fhonn comharchumainn a chruthú le gur féidir seirbhís mhíochaine a chur ar fáil lasmuigh de ghnáthuaireanta oibre
These co-operatives receive financial assistance from the State
Faigheann na comharchumainn seo cúnamh airgeadais ón stát
The co-operative may be based in a health centre, public hospital or in another location, often provided by the Health Service Executive
D’fhéadfadh an comharchumann a bheith lonnaithe in ionad sláinte, in ospidéal poiblí nó i láthair eile, arna cur ar fáil go minic ag Feidhmeannacht na Seirbhíse Sláinte
Participating GPs provide this service on a rota basis in the evenings, at weekends and on bank and public holidays
Cuireann GPanna an tseirbhís seo ar fáil ar bhonn uainchláir sna tráthnónta, ag an deireadh seachtaine agus ar laethanta saoire bainc agus poiblí
Generally the service is available to the patients of the GPs participating in the co-op
Ní bhíonn an tseirbhís seo ar fáil de ghnáth ach amháin d’othair na GPanna atá rannpháirteach sa chomharchumann
It is necessary to telephone a contact number to access the service and the appropriate care may be telephone advice by a nurse or doctor
Is gá glao teileafóin a chur chun rochtain a fháil ar an tseirbhís agus d’fhéadfadh gur ionann an cúram cuí is comhairle ó altra nó ó dhochtúir ar an teileafón
Care may also include attendance at a treatment centre or a visit to your home by the doctor on duty
D’fhéadfadh freastal ar ionad cóireála leighis nó cuairt ar do theach ón dochtúir ar dualgas a bheith san áireamh le cúram chomh maith
Medical card and GP visit card holders don't have to pay for the services provided by the GP out-of-hours co-operatives
Ní gá dóibh siúd a bhfuil cárta leighis nó cárta cuairt dochtúra acu íoc as na seirbhísí a chuireann comharchumainn GP lasmuigh de ghnáthuaireanta ar fáil
Other patients have to pay a fee
Ní mór d’othair eile íoc as costas iomlán úsáid na seirbhíse seo
Find a list of GP out-of-hours services here
Faigh liosta seirbhísí GPanna lasmuigh d’uaireanta gnó anseo
Accident and Emergency Departments of public hospitals
Ranna Timpistí agus Éigeandála in ospidéil phoiblí
Most public hospitals provide accident and emergency services
Cuireann formhór na n-ospidéal poiblí seirbhísí timpistí agus éigeandála ar fáil
Anybody in Ireland with a medical emergency is entitled to attend their Accident and Emergency Departments
Tá duine ar bith in Éirinn atá faoi réir ag éigeandáil mhíochaine i dteideal freastal ar roinn Timpistí agus Éigeandála
You may have to pay charges for public hospital services
D’fhéadfadh costais a bheith i gceist maidir le seirbhísí ospidéil phoiblí
People attending the Accident and Emergency Department of a public hospital are prioritised on the basis of medical need
Tugtar tosaíocht dóibh siúd a dhéanann freastal ar Roinn Timpistí agus Éigeandála in ospidéil phoiblí de réir an ghátair mhíochaine
You may be required to wait for treatment if you have a non-urgent injury or illness
D’fhéadfadh go mbeadh ar dhuine a bhfuil tinneas neamhphráinneach air/uirthi fanacht ar chóireáil leighis
Some private hospitals and clinics offer emergency services
Cuireann roinnt ospidéal phríobháideacha seirbhísí éigeandála ar fáil
You will be charged the full cost of care in private facilities
Gearrfar costas iomlán an chúraim i saoráidí príobháideacha ort
Entitlement of visitors to Ireland to emergency health services
Teidlíocht cuairteoirí ar Éirinn i leith seirbhísí éigeandála sláinte

If you are a national of a member state of the European Union (EU), European Economic Area (EEA) or Switzerland and you are travelling or staying temporarily in Ireland, you are entitled to receive medical care if you become ill or have an accident

Má tá tú i do náisiúnach ó bhallstáit den Aontas Eorpach (AE), den Limistéar Eorpach Eacnamaíoch (LEE) nó ón Eilvéis atá ag taisteal in Éirinn nó ag fanacht go sealadach in Éirinn, tá tú i dteideal seirbhísí sláinte má éiríonn tú tinn nó má tharlaíonn timpiste duit
These services are provided free of charge through the public health system on production of a valid European Health Insurance Card (EHIC)
Cuirtear na seirbhísí seo ar fáil saor in aisce tríd an gcóras sláinte poiblí ach Cárta Eorpach um Árachas Sláinte (EHIC) bailí a thaispeáint
There is a reciprocal agreement on medical treatment for temporary visitors between Ireland and Australia
Tá comhaontú cómhalartach ar chóir leighis do chuairteoirí sealadacha idir Éire agus an Astráil
Under the agreement, Australian visitors who access emergency public treatment pay the hospital charges that apply to people who are ordinarily resident in Ireland
Faoin gcomhaontú, íocann cuairteoirí na hAstráile a fhaigheann cóireáil phoiblí éigeandála na táillí ospidéil a bhaineann le daoine a bhfuil gnáthchónaí orthu in Éirinn
If you are on a temporary visit to Ireland and are not covered under EU regulations, you will have to pay the cost of attendance at an Accident and Emergency Department
Má tá tú ar cuairt shealadach ar Éirinn, beidh ort íoc as an gcostas a ghabhann le freastal ar Roinn Timpistí agus Éigeandála

If you are not a national of an EU/EEA member state, or from Switzerland or Australia, you may also be charged the full economic cost of any further treatment, including medical care in an acute hospital

Mura bhfuil tú i do náisiúnach ó bhallstát AE/LEE, nó ón Eilvéis nó ón Astráil, beidh ort íoc as an gcostas eacnamaíoch iomlán a ghabhann le cóireáil leighis bhreise ar bith, lena n-áirítear cúram míochaine in ospidéal géarmhíochaine
Therefore taking out private medical travel insurance before travelling is recommended
Moltar duit árachas míochaine príobháidí chun críocha taistil a cheannach sula rachfá ag taisteal
